stormctrl:IfPol.label: Storm Control Interface Policy
comment: The storm control interface policy. A traffic storm occurs when packets flood the LAN, creating excessive traffic and degrading network performance. You can use the traffic storm control feature to prevent disruptions on ports by a broadcast, multicast, or unknown unicast traffic storm on physical interfaces.
User annotation. Suggested format orchestrator:value
annotation.label: Annotation

comment: burst rate in pps
bcBurstPps.label: Broadcast Max burst size

comment: burst rate in % (upto 1 decimal)
bcBurstRate.label: Broadcast Max burst size

comment: rate in % (upto 1 decimal)
bcRate.label: Broadcast Traffic rate

comment: rate in pps
bcRatePps.label: Broadcast Traffic rate

comment: The packets per second (PPS) burst interval rate for the storm control policy. During this interval, the traffic level which is expressed as packets flowing per second through the port, is then compared with the traffic storm control level that you configured. When the ingress traffic reaches the traffic storm control level that is configured on the port, traffic storm control drops the traffic until the interval ends.
burstPps.label: Max burst size

comment: The traffic burst rate percentage.
burstRate.label: Max burst size

comment: Delete or ignore. For internal use only.
childAction.label: childAction

comment: Specifies a description of the policy definition.

comment: The packets per second (PPS) interval rate for the storm control policy. During this interval, the traffic level which is expressed as packets flowing per second through the port, is then compared with the traffic storm control level that you configured. When the ingress traffic reaches the traffic storm control level that is configured on the port, traffic storm control drops the traffic until the interval ends.
ratePps.label: Tarffic rate

comment: Identifies an object from its siblings within the context of its parent object. The distinguished name contains a sequence of relative names.

comment:
In a setter method: specifies that an object should be created. An error is returned if the object already exists.  
In the return value of a setter method: indicates that an object has been created.

comment: The storm control interface policy type. The policy type prevents disruptions on ports by a broadcast, multicast, or unknown unicast traffic storm on physical interfaces. The policy type is set to ALL types of traffic by default and can not be changed.
